speakers.biography:
Elif Boncuk has been working on mobile technologies especially on Android (since Eclair) and also IOS as a full-stack developer since the team formation in her current company. She is a Senior Software Specialist at Garanti Technology.
Her passionate about Android is making apps more performant.
Elif is engaged with Google Developer Group and Women Techmakers Istanbul as organizer. She loves to speak at tech events and also organize and attend to them. She blogs in her native language at her blog(elifboncuk.com) about everything but mostly tech and also at Medium in English and only tech.
In addition, she loves to travel and she is a professional photographer but her favourite photography object is Android sculpture. You can find her taking photos with Androids at any time.

Alex is a software engineer at Microsoft Berlin, where he works on To-Do for both iOS and macOS. His previous mobile experience includes Branch in New York City and Facebook in London on Rooms and React Native.

Graham heads up software architecture and data strategy at Wealth Wizards, a financial technology company in Leamington Spa, England. He has spent a long time in the software industry and even occasionally enjoys it.

Ana is a software engineer with over 5 years experience in Android.
During college she focused on various e-learning projects and plagiarism detection. After getting her Masters degree in CS, she started developing for Android, working on various projects in the telecommunication, medical and travel industry. After switching to banking and security, in 2016 she took the role of Technical Manager of Mobile banking.
In addition to coding, she loves organising workshops and working directly with clients, helping to close the gap between the technical and practical in mobile.
Advisor and Investor

Fernando Cejas is a Software Engineer focused on Mobile Platforms. He has worked for several companies in a wide variety of projects in J2ME, C-Sharp, Java, Php, Ruby, Scala and Kotlin in different contexts: Social networks, NFC/RFID Hardware Solutions, E-Commerce and Music Platforms. 
He has been involved on Android since its appearance and currently as part of his job he advocates developers by exploring new technologies, speaking at conferences and sharing knowledge.

Krzysztof is an iOS developer, known for creating Objective-C Playgrounds, Apple’s Essential Apps like Foldify and 3D Game Engines. Passionate about writing quality code and helping other do the same. He blogs on merowing.info and open sources tools/libraries on github.com/krzysztofzablocki

Caro is an iOS Developer with 5 years of experience working on various iOS Apps. 
She spent the last years working on big complex projects like VLC for iOS, where she was able to gather knowledge on how to navigate matured projects with legacy code.
This enabled her to hone and expand her debugging and architecture skills.

A seven-year veteran of Apple, Dave DeLong is an accomplished iOS engineer with a passion for teaching, and hacking the Objective-C runtime. During his time at Apple, he worked on the UIKit framework, Developer Evangelism, and Apple Maps. He now works at Snap, Inc. on the Snapchat app.
Dave, his family, and his large collection of bowties live near Salt Lake City, UT, where he’s an active member of the local developer community. He can often be found on Twitter teaching developers about all the ways that calendrical calculations can go wrong.

Daniel is the author of more than a dozen books including the best selling book [A Swift Kickstart](http://editorscut.com/Book/SwiftKickstart/bookPage.html). He has written apps for the iPhone and the iPad since the SDKs first appeared and has written programs for the Mac all the way back to System 7. Daniel presents iPhone, Cocoa, and Swift training and consults through his company [Dim Sum Thinking](https://www.dimsumthinking.com/). When he's not coding or talking about coding for the Mac, the iPhone, and the iPad he's probably cooking or hanging out with friends.

Wilfried is an African Android developer who like to learn and share Software development knowledge.
When he isn't coding, he enjoys reading, writing, doing sports and seing TV shows.
His mantra is "Work hard, play hard, rest hard"

Matthias is the Lead Developer at IdeasOnCanvas, where he works on MindNode for iOS, MacOS and watchOS. He is passionate about a lot of things, but front and foremost technology, psychology and especially the intersection of both. Therefore he is equally interested in technical aspects of a product, as well as its user experience.

Andrea Falcone is a Senior Software Engineer at Google, in the Developer Products Group working on Firebase. She has been with the Crashlytics team since 2013 and has built many pieces of the tooling, including Android Studio Plugin, Crashlytics Android SDK, Gradle plugin, Beta by Crashlytics and fastlane.
iOS at Spotify. Creator of PhoneNumberKit, Zip and Interpolate. http://www.github.com/marmelroy

Hey, I am coorganizing the Google Developer Group Co-Organiser @Berlindroid, currently working as a Android and Java Developer @Contentful. Before, I was a Software Engineer @HERE and @Wooga. Being a Research Associate @HHIFraunhofer in my early years, I discovered my passion for Virtual Reality and Augmented Reality, which survives as a side project ever since.

Vikram has been a mobile developer since when WAP was still cool and Symbian and J2ME were still fashionable. He founded mobile at local.ch in 2007, where he went on to develop massively successful mobile web, iOS and Android apps. Over the years, he's helped build one of the most awesome mobile engineering teams in Switzerland.
He's very Spanish, very Indian and increasingly Swiss – having grown up between Gran Canaria and Mumbai, he calls Zurich home.
Vikram is also a co-author of the venerable Mobile Developer's Guide To The Galaxy.

Android team leader (worked on apps with millions of downloads) with more than 15 years of experience in various development and management positions. Developed social impact and media apps with millions of users and winners of Google Awards in 2017, 2016 and 2015. Speaker at various conferences (Droidcon, CodeMobile UK). Co-author of an upcoming book on reactive programming, "Grokking Rx".
Gautier is an Android Developer by day, and a Google Developer Expert for IoT.

Antonio Carzaniga is a professor and a founding member (since 2004) of the Faculty of Informatics at the University of Lugano, Switzerland. From 2001 to 2007 he was an assistant research professor in the Department of Computer Science at the University of Colorado at Boulder. Antonio Carzaniga received the Laurea degree in electronics engineering and the Ph.D. degree in computer science from Politecnico di Milano, Italy.  Antonio Carzaniga's primary research interests are in the areas of distributed systems and software engineering, specifically in content-based networking, information-centric networking, distributed publish/subscribe systems, middleware, software adaptability and automatic fault tolerance, and testing. He also conducted research in software configuration management and code mobility.

David Hart is the Lead iOS Developer at Atipik, a web & mobile development shop in Geneva. After beginning his career in the games industry, David reconverted to mobile development in 2009. Since then, he been crafting apps for iOS with a deep care for user experience and design. More recently, he’s shown a strong interest in Swift through participation in the Swift Evolution process and contributions to the Swift Package Manager.

George Karavias has been riding the mobile revolution wave from the get go and has had a blast creating over 25 mobile applications in the process. Currently he is obsessing over Machine Learning and Mixed Reality.

news.title: Welcome to App Builders 2018!
news.content: Only a few months left until the third edition of App Builders is going to take place in Lugano, Switzerland.
